description: Decimal expansion of cube root of 4.
comments: Let h = 4^(1/3). Then (h+1,0) is the x-intercept of the shortest segment from the x-axis through (1,2) to the y-axis; see A197008. - _Clark Kimberling_, Oct 10 2011
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
Horace S. Uhler, Many-figure approximations for cubed root of 2, cubed root of 3, cubed root of 4, and cubed root of 9 with chi2 data, Scripta Math. 18, (1952), p. 173-176.
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000

Horace S. Uhler, Many-figure approximations for cubed root of 2, cubed root of 3, cubed root of 4, and cubed root of 9 with chi2 data, Scripta Math. 18, (1952). 173-176. [Annotated scanned copies of pages 175 and 176 only]
prog: (PARI) { default(realprecision, 20080); x=4^(1/3); for (n=1, 20000, d=floor(x); x=(x-d)*10; write("b005480.txt", n, " ", d)); } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, May 07 2009, with a correction made May 19 2009
crossrefs: Cf. A002947 (continued fraction). - _Harry J. Smith_, May 07 2009
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_; entry revised Apr 23 2006
